#Text=Taran Davies
#Text=Taran
#Text=Davies
#Text=is a film producer and director best known for his documentary film Afghan Stories ( 2002 ) , and the IMAX feature documentary Journey to Mecca ( 2009 ) .
#Text=Life and education
#Text=Davies was born in New York City and raised in London and Hong Kong .

#Text=He graduated from Harvard University in 1993 [ 1 ] [ 2 ] with a BA in English and American Literature , and studied documentary filmmaking with Richard Rogers , Director of the Film Study Center at The Department of Visual and Environmental Film Studies at Harvard . [ 2 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Davies founded Wicklow Films in 1994 to produce , direct and write a series of films about the Islamic world .
#Text=Three - Afghan Stories , Mountain Men and Holy Wars and The Land Beyond the River - were broadcast on the Sundance Channel in March 2003 with its FilmFest Portraits of Islam . [ 3 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=The Land Beyond the River ( 1998 ) is about his journey through Central Asia in 1995 .
#Text=It was broadcast by PBS [ 2 ] in November 1997 and was shot entirely on Hi 8 . [ 6 ]
#Text=Davies travelled to the Caucasus in the summer of 1999 to film Mountain Men and Holy Wars . [ 7 ]
#Text=The September 11 attacks marked a turning point for Davies . [ 1 ] [ 8 ]

#Text=Having witnessed the collapse of the World Trade Center , he gave up his job in finance to set out to make Afghan Stories and commit to making films that might shed light on conflict , its causes and effects . [ 1 ] [ 9 ] [ 10 ] [ 11 ]
#Text=Afghan Stories premiered at the Venice Film Festival [ 8 ] in September 2002 , and was described as “ a brilliant portrait ” by The Rough Guide to Cult Movies . [ 12 ]
#Text=The New York Times called it “ invaluable ” [ 13 ] [ 14 ] [ 15 ] [ 16 ]

#Text=Davies founded Cosmic Picture in 2004 with Dominic Cunningham-Reid to produce giant screen productions to enhance people 's knowledge of history , religion , culture and geography . [ 11 ] [ 17 ]
#Text=He conceived [ 11 ] the IMAX film Journey to Mecca and developed it with Cunningham-Reid , Executive Producer Jake Eberts , [ 18 ] and Director Bruce Neibaur . [ 19 ]
#Text=Journey to Mecca was released in January 2009 in Abu Dhabi on the world 's largest outdoor screen , [ 20 ] specifically constructed for the occasion . [ 21 ]

#Text=Produced by Cosmic Picture and SK Films and distributed by SK Films and National Geographic , Journey to Mecca tells the story of one of the greatest travelers in history , Ibn Battuta , and his journey to Mecca in the 14th century .
#Text=Journey to Mecca contains the first IMAX material ever filmed of the Hajj , one of the longest running annual events in history [ 21 ] [ 22 ] [ 23 ] [ 24 ] [ 25 ] [ 26 ]
#Text=Davies also produced and directed , with Ghasem Ebrahimian , Roads to Mecca , [ 27 ] the story of the making of Journey to Mecca .
#Text=In 2009
#Text=Davies started work on the IMAX film Jerusalem with Daniel Ferguson ( Writer , Director , Producer ) , George Duffield ( Producer ) and Jake Eberts ( Executive Producer ) .
#Text=The film , narrated by Benedict Cumberbatch , focuses on the cultural , political and religious importance of Jerusalem [ 28 ] and was released in 2013 . [ 29 ] [ 30 ]
#Text=Other
#Text=Davies is a member of the Explorers ' Club . [ 15 ]

#Text=He directed and produced his first film , Around the Sacred Sea , in 1993 about a five-month horseback expedition around Siberia 's Lake Baikal , the world 's largest freshwater lake . [ 2 ] [ 31 ] [ 32 ]
